page.title: 09INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: At Hythe library the information storage system used is a microfiche viewer. Each sheet is 6"x3.5" approx in size and there are 255 squares on each sheet. One square is an index of that sheet. There are 12 books in each square, which totals 3048 books. Each book's information contains the author, title, price, publishing date, whether it is hard or paper backed, whether it is a junior or senior book. There is an abbreviated town name which tells where there are copies of the book. For each 'edition' of the book there is an ISBN (International Standard Book Number). There is one number per edition, not per copy. Every 2 months the microfiche catalogues are thrown away and an updated edition circulated. There is also a weekly addendum.
